Appearance
From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: Appendix:Variations of "ananas"

Translingual

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Ultimately from Old Tupi naná.

Proper noun

[edit]

Ananas m

  1. A taxonomic genus within the family Bromeliaceae – pineapple and similar plants.

Hypernyms

[edit]
  • (genus): Eukaryota – superkingdom; Plantae – kingdom; Viridiplantae – subkingdom; Streptophyta – infrakingdom; Embryophyta – superphylum; Tracheophyta – phylum; Spermatophytina – subphylum; angiosperms, monocots, commelinids – clades; Poales – order; Bromeliaceae – family; Bromelioideae - subfamily

Hyponyms

[edit]
  • (genus): Ananas ananassoides, Ananas bracteatus, Ananas comosus, Ananas fritzmuelleri, Ananas lucidus, Ananas microcephalus, Ananas nanus, Ananas parguazensis - species

Derived terms

[edit]
  • Ananassa
  • Pseudananas
  • Bromelia ananas

References

[edit]
  • Ananas on Wikipedia.Wikipedia
  • Ananas on Wikispecies.Wikispecies
  • Category:Ananas on Wikimedia Commons.Wikimedia Commons
  • Ananas at USDA Plants database
  • Ananas at Integrated Taxonomic Information System.
  • Ananas at the Catalogue of Life 
  • Ananas at National Center for Biotechnology Information
  • Ananas at The Plant List

German

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

16th century, from Middle French ananas and/or Dutch ananas, themselves from Portuguese ananás, from Old Tupi naná. In sense two, an abbreviation of Ananaserdbeere (literally “pineapple strawberry”), translating French fraise ananas.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ˈa.na.nas/
  • Audio (Germany (Berlin)):(file)
  • Hyphenation: A‧na‧nas

Noun

[edit]

Ananas f (genitive Ananas, plural Ananas or Ananasse)

  1. pineapple
    • 1839, Jakob Ernst von Reider, Die treue Kundgebung des Geheimnisses, Augsburg, page 16:
      Die Arten der Ananas. Die Pflanze. Man kennt über 15 Arten Ananas.
      The types of Ananas. The plant. One knows over 15 types of Ananas.
  2. (Austria) garden strawberry (Fragaria × ananassa)
    Synonym: Gartenerdbeere

Declension

[edit]
Declension of Ananas [feminine]
singular plural
indef. def. noun def. noun
nominative eine die Ananas die Ananas, Ananasse
genitive einer der Ananas der Ananas, Ananasse
dative einer der Ananas den Ananas, Ananassen
accusative eine die Ananas die Ananas, Ananasse

Derived terms

[edit]
  • Ananasfrucht
  • Ananasgewächs
  • Ananaspflanze
  • Ananassaft
  • Ananasschneider

Further reading

[edit]
  • “Ananas” in Digitales Wörterbuch der deutschen Sprache
  • “Ananas” in Uni Leipzig: Wortschatz-Lexikon
  • “Ananas” in Duden online
  • Ananas on the German Wikipedia.Wikipedia de

Limburgish

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • annanas (Veldeke spelling)
  • Annanass (Eupen, spelling)
  • Ane̩nas (Rheinische Dokumenta spelling)
    • annenas (Veldeke spelling)

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Middle French ananas, from Spanish ananás, from Portuguese ananás, adapted from Old Tupi naná.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ˈa.na.nas/, [ˈɑ.nɑ.nɑs]

Noun

[edit]

Ananas f (plural Ananasse or Ananase̩) (German-based spelling, Rheinische Dokumenta spelling)

  1. pineapple

Luxembourgish

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ˈananas/, [ˈɑnɑnɑs]

Noun

[edit]

Ananas m or f (plural Ananassen or Ananas)

  1. pineapple
